revised_title: High Resolution Electron Microscopic and X-ray Studies of Non-Random Disorder in Layered Silicates
tldr: This study investigates the non-random disorder and identifies new polytypes in the layered silicate chloritoid using high-resolution electron microscopy and X-ray diffraction. The research highlights the limitations of X-ray diffraction in solving these problems and demonstrates the power of electron microscopy in revealing local atomic arrangements and structural faults in minerals.
